p: The improvement of air quality in Barcelona, Spain, under lockdown measures was recently reported [ 13]. After two weeks of lockdown, urban air pollution markedly decreased but with substantial differences among pollutants. The most significant reduction was estimated for Black Carbon and NO 2 (-45 to -51 %), pollutants mainly related to traffic emissions. A lower reduction was observed for PM10 (-28 to -31.0 %). By contrast, O 3 levels increased (+33 to +57 % of the 8 h daily maxima), probably due to lower titration of O 3 by NO and the decrease of NOx in a VOC-limited environment. In the same direction correlation between NO 2 levels with COVID-19 outbreak analysis has been conducted on a regional scale and combined with the number of death cases taken from 66 administrative regions in Italy, Spain, France and Germany [ 14].
